eu_initiatives:
ECAP follow the activities related to the Construction Products Regulation and its implementation: 
 
1) ECAP Secretary General attends on behalf of SBS (Small Business Standards) the following meetings: Standing Committee on Construction, Advisory Group, CPR implementation technical platforms. 
 
2) ECAP Secretary General attends on behalf of CPE (Construction Products Europe) the following meetings: EOTA Technical Board. 
ECAP attends bilateral meetings with EOTA and the European Commission on the transfer of ETAGs into EADs. 
 
3) ECAP has been member of the high level tripartite strategic forum of: “Construction 2020”, Groups: “Sustainable use of natural resources" and “Internal Market for Construction Products & Services".
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
ECAP attends several CEN and EOTA WGs and TCs and events dedicated to stakeholders, held seminars and speaches on SMEs and the CPR and writes articles on European trade press. 
ECAP is actively involved in several CEN and EOTA technical groups (see list of experts and working groups in www.eota.eu and www.cencenelec.eu). 
 
ECAP takes part to events related to the CPR and how European SMEs implement it, such as:  
- Brussels, Sept 2015: speach at the high level roundtable event looking at how standardization boosts European Business competitiveness, organizede by CEN-CENELEC, Parliament Magazine, chaired by Vicky Ford MEP. 
- Milan, May 2016: sponsor of the meeting of FIB (Federation International du Beton) 
- Wien, Sept. 2016: speach at FEICA (Association of the European Adhesive and Sealant Industry) conference 
- Milan, Oct 2016: seminar at Fastener and Fixings Italy (trade fair) 
 
ECAP is partner of the EU-funded project “Energy Saving Technologies for Buildings Envelope Retrofitting” (EASEE): http://www.easee-project.eu/ 
 
Example of trade press articles: 
- Fastener and Fixings, Oct 2016: "Getting the SME voice heard" 
- Ferrutensil, March 2016: "L'Europa etica delle norme"
